plyranges

    • Using plyranges to perform common genomic data wrangling tasks

Sort a Ranges object

Sort a Ranges object

# S3 method for GenomicRanges
arrange(.data, ...)

# S3 method for Ranges
arrange(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

A Ranges object.
...

Comma seperated list of variable names.

Examples

rng <- as_iranges(data.frame(start = 1:10, width = 10:1))
rng <- mutate(rng, score = runif(10))
arrange(rng, score)
#> IRanges object with 10 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>            start       end     width |             score
#>        <integer> <integer> <integer> |         <numeric>
#>    [1]        10        10         1 | 0.130288870073855
#>    [2]         7        10         4 | 0.180407245177776
#>    [3]         3        10         8 | 0.348691981751472
#>    [4]         1        10        10 | 0.488305994076654
#>    [5]         8        10         3 | 0.629390850430354
#>    [6]         5        10         6 | 0.695274139055982
#>    [7]         6        10         5 | 0.889453538926318
#>    [8]         2        10         9 | 0.928505074931309
#>    [9]         4        10         7 | 0.954157707514241
#>   [10]         9        10         2 | 0.989564136601985
# you can also use dplyr::desc to arrange by descending order
